reviewText: After the previous fantasic boxsets, it was clear that the old saying, "good things come to those who wait" was true. Naruto Shippuden reached its best arc so far, and with minimal filler interference, resulting in a memorable collection of episodes that one can feel proud of owning. However, the same cannot be said for this boxset.Containing episodes 180 to 192 (12 episodes) this set is chronologically supposed to follow the events of the Pain arc, but instead takes us back 3 years to Naruto as a twelve year old. This set contains practically 99% filler and will undoubtedly be a disappointment to fans eagerly awaiting the next slice of canon brilliance. Furthermore, these fillers offer flashbacks to events that never actually happened in Naruto part 1; which may only put off viewers who haven't seen the first part (episodes 1 - 136).  Now I don't mind original content as long as it is done well and has some thought put into it, but that isn't the case here: they're bland, boring and don't tell us anything we didn't know before; Naruto was treated dreadfully by the villages etc. Every filler that involves Naruto's character uses this form of development to death. It's a shame because fillers either portray him as an idiot or a as someone shallow - he's neither in reality, but clearly someone didn't tell the filler writers.In short, this set is pointless. If their is one redeeming feature of these episodes, then it is the use of the old soundtrack which brings back a sense of nostalgia, but really, that's it. For those who have money constraints then I advise against purchasing this set as I'd be ultimately telling you to throw your money away. Unless you are a die hard fan who cannot stand having a space in your collection, then you can safely avoid this set without any worries of missing anything that continues the story.
summary: Skip if you don't like fillers.

reviewText: Not just filler.  While the Leaf Village is being rebuilt, genin and jonin-sensei reminisce past events that were not completely revealed in the first series.  Someone told me that to really get the most out of Naruto: Shippuden, one must start from the very beginning with episode one (eng dub) then patiently move through each episode without skipping over or rushing through any episodes that follow.  That persons advice was well received.  Having watched attentively every episode in order, Box Set 1 through 14, Episodes 1-179, I thoroughly enjoyed the way Box Set 15 played out (Episodes 180 - 192).  I give this series a five star two thumbs up ovation for being arguably the BEST anime series to-date!!!!!  "Believe it" - Naruto

reviewText: After the climatic Episode 175 from Set 14, I knew I was in for filler for a while.  I was going to pass on these, but decided to get it on a whim.  Turns out they add some good background to the characters.  One of the best things about Naruto is how well developed the main characters are.  These little vignettes just add to that.

reviewText: I would say that this is not my favorite DVD set but for me it is fun to watch... and the episode called "Neji Chronicles' a great one if you like the Hyuga clan. Neji and especially Hinata are kind of the feature of this one episode. Some of the episodes are funny and some have a lot of action. It is all filler...which means it is not in the official manga version of things. This is not the same as the exciting sets #13 and #14.One thing that is missing from all of the entire Naruto anime and manga, from the start is romance...it just has never happened. There are crushes, especially Hinata's feelings for Naruto...and secondly, Sakura's for Sasuke. There have been dramatic scenes of how these female characters feel about their crush...but never a notice from the male character. I love Naruto but after so many years I feel that the continual fighting and wonderful characters need some romance to add some feeling to the lead characters. I think many fans would agree. So....if you want fighting and great characters this is for you...personally, I have always been a Naruto guy...but if you want true romance, this anime is NOT for you.
summary: Good for background and Neji Chronicles is great!
Title: N/A

reviewText: While some people may not enjoy filler episodes I've never had a problem with them,the episodes give time for the animators to draw up the story episodes and give the manga writers more time for new chapters to the series so it's a good mix for both the anime and manga fans. The set deals primarily with Naruto and friends before his three year journey with Jariya as well see Naruto team up with either Sasuke and Sakura or with the other teams(10/9/8) or even with some of the Chunin of the Leaf Village with some mostly hilarious missions and a few serious ones. Again while the episodes aren't part of the manga it gives you more storytime to connect with the characters and helps endear them to you more so you actually care more on what happens to them in the series overall.So while fans wait for the next box set to continue the Shippuden manga story arc we have an enjoyable filler set to entertain fans until then.
summary: Yes While Filler Episodes Still An Enjoyable Set To Own
